children.subject: I heard this class is really though, and that the professor is not very accessible :( too bad I heard that more than once.

I took EE225B last spring. The class is graded on ~50% HW, ~40% Final Project, 10% Participation. Homework alternates from writing 1-page responses to selected research papers and programming assignments based on problems written in the textbook. It is a good balance of learning image processing fundamentals (filtering, 2D signals, compression, feature extraction, etc.) as well as seeing how these are used in computer vision research (via CNNs, object detection, image segmentation, image retrieval, etc.). Highly recommend this class for anyone wanting to get involved with computer vision research. Professor Zakhor is really good.
Take CS194-26. Better to let a CS class teach a CS topic :)

history.content: These classes seem to be the same thing, and EE 225B is opened up to undergrads. What's the difference between between how EE teaches photography and how CS teaches photography?
history.subject: CS 194-26 VS EE 225B
